page.title: 18Tonbridge Market
page.content: The market began in the 1300's,it was both a cattle market and a fair. In 1850 the cattle market was behind an Inn in Back Lane, now called Bank Street.The last cattle market was on Tuesday the 28th of September 1971. The market is 9.00 am to 4.30 pm but the people who rent the stalls arrive between 5.30 am and 7.00 am and they leave between 5.00 pm and 7.00 pm. Some people make things to sell. There are many kinds of stalls. There are stalls for clothes, fruit, vegetables, toys,stationery,books, sweets, pets and many other things. There are also mobile snack bars which sell fish and chips, potatoes, ice_creams and hot_dogs. People go to the market because things are often cheaper than in the shops. Tonbridge market may be closed because the council are going to open a Sunday market.
